lecture1.title: Web Systems Development
lecture1.description: This lecture covers introductions as well as a review of the syllabus and expectations for the Web Sys course.

lecture2.title: The Basics (refresh your memory)
lecture2.description: This lecture is a review from Intro to ITWS, going over topics like: Servers - Hosting, Ports and Protocol, URI schemes, DNS, HTTP, HTTPS, 3 tier model, Idempotence, Requests and Responses.

lecture3.title: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)
lecture3.description: This lecture begins witha review of Semantics vs Presentation, then covers major CSS topics like: Anatomy of a Style Sheet & CSS rule, CSS Selectors (Atrribute & Pseudo), CSS Pseudo-classes & Pseudo Elements, Properties, Units, Box Model, Specificity, and "Why CSS?".

lecture4.title: CSS
lecture4.description: This lecture is Part 2 of previous, covering: CSS Combinators, Animations, CSS Rules, Minification, and Bootstrap.

lecture5.title: JavaScript
lecture5.description: This lecture covers: What JavaScript is, Typing, Why JavaScript is Useful, Using JavaScript - When not to use it, Adding JavaScript, Writing JavaScript - Language Elements (Comments, Variables, Values, Operators, Control Structures, Functions), DOM & CSS, and Events.

lecture6.title: AJAX & JSON
lecture6.description: This lecture covers: JSON Format, Advantages, Uses, AJAX & jQuery.

lecture7.title: APIs!!!
lecture7.description: This lecture introduces: APIs, API Styles (SOAP, REST) & History, Constraints, and Real-world API Examples.

lecture8.title: Front End Optimization
lecture8.description: This lecture covers topics of: Performance, Minimizing Markup, Efficient Servers, ETags, Efficient Media, Efficient CSS, Efficent JavaScript, Efficient AJAX, Polling, and UX.

lecture9.title: PHP & MySQL
lecture9.description: This lecture introduces: Databases, SQL Users, Connecting to Databases & MySQL, PDOs, Queries & Statements, and Sessions.

lecture10.title: Intro to PHP - More About PHP
lecture10.description: This lecture continues: PHP Syntax, Datatypes, Operators, Control Structures, Functoins, Objects, Bsic Web I/O.

lecture11.title: More PHP
lecture11.description: This lecture continues on topics: Interfaces, Overloading, Abstract Classes, and Polymorphism in PHP.

lecture12.title: Authentication & Authorization
lecture12.description: This lecture covers: Authentication vs. Authorization, Better Password Storage, Password Salting, Permission Based Authorization, Role Based Authorization, and Combining Roles & Permissions.

lab1.title: Lab 1
lab1.description: In this lab, students created a group portfolio, using individual portfolios and incorporating microformats.

lab2.title: Lab 2: “September 17th: Constitution Day” Lab (Constitution Week Lab)
lab2.description: In this lab, students read various articles and amendments of the constitution, annotated, and displayed them in commemoration of Constitution Day.

lab3.title: Lab 3 – JavaScript, AJAX, JSON, using APIs
lab3.description: In this lab, students built a weather app with HTML using OpenWeather and an API of their choice.

lab4.title: Lab 4
lab4.description: In this lab, students were asked to remake their Lab 3 using only AI to generate the resources necessary for the lab, documenting the process.

lab5.title: Lab 5 Part 1
lab5.description: In this lab, students visited the Bloomberg terminals on campus, documenting the process, and learned how to do various operations in order to view live financial information about real-world companies.

lab6.title: Lab 5 Part 2
lab6.description: Students were asked to work in groups in order to write a 1 page report on strategies to incorporate socioeconomic and financial data available in the Bloomberg terminal into their in-class projects.

lab7.title: Lab #6 - PHP, OOP and Input Handling
lab7.description: Students were tasked in this lab with adding Subtraction, Multiplication, and Division functionality to a .php calculator and answer questions.

lab8.title: Lab 7
lab8.description: In this lab (the current one!) students were asked to create and host a server to display their php & database representing courses, students and grades, specifically allowing functionality to archive lecture and lab elements of the Web Sys course.
